meanings.definition: Having a specific purpose or goal in mind.
meanings.sent1: She always has an aimful plan before starting any project.
meanings.sent2: The students worked aimfully on their science experiment.
meanings.sent3: His aimful determination to win the game was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The aimful focus of the detective helped solve the mystery quickly.
meanings.sent5: The aimful steps she took led her to success in her career.

meanings.definition: Intentionally directed towards a particular target or objective.
meanings.sent1: The archer's aimful shot hit the bullseye perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The company's aimful marketing strategy attracted many new customers.
meanings.sent3: His aimful aim at the dartboard made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The aimful aim of the missile struck the enemy's base.
meanings.sent5: The aimful focus of the team led them to victory in the championship.
